intro: Angostura cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
